title: Mages bot lane
body:
Just curious with the prevalence of AD mids/jgs why aren't mages considered for the bot lane?
I mean, most of them have a faster power curve then an ADC and can provide the magic damage needed for the team comp.

Champs like Syndra, Ziggs, Ryze, Lissandra, Lulu and Ahri all have similar ranges to AD's plus have their own CC they can chain with supports to wreck an ADC

replies.body:
the reason why APs went mid and ADs went bot is because ADs needed the safety of a 2nd person protecting them for CSing to get to their large gold cost builds that gave their power curves, and APs went mid for the faster levels through faster waves getting to them giving more xp. so, going duo bot limits their xp further, slowing down their mid game power spikes.

basically, the only viable APs bot lane would be ones with massive AP scaling, where items is their biggest gains.

It's true that yes, they can make the laning phase down in bot lane very dangerous. However, once the laning phase is over, they need items to be effective, seeing as what they offer is damage. Current supports have heals, Area Denial CC, slows, shields and others all mixed around in their kits. Janna has a slow a shield, a huge area knockback, a heal and a knockup. With these many things, items aren't completely necessary to still be effective in lategame teamfights. Mages however, need items, which comes from CS and kills, which they don't get in the support role, to be effective, and so, are weak and less effective in teamfights than current supports.

In short, mages aren't effective in teamfights, needs more items.

I now realise I misread your post, that replace the ADC with a mage. But an ADC is nearly completely mandatory, seeing as AD mids are mostly assassins, and dont put out enough damage throughout the entire fight. You need an ADC to put out large amounts of DPS over large amounts of time.
